subtitle.part1: We have sent you an email with a

about.title: About Zero-Knowledge Encryption
about.zke_def: Zero Knowledge Encryption (ZKE) refers to a robust security measure that ensures the utmost protection of your data. With ZKE, your information is encrypted locally on your device before being uploaded to the cloud, and only you hold the encryption keys, guaranteeing that no one, including the service provider, can access your data without your explicit permission. This empowers you with complete control over your sensitive information while enjoying the convenience and flexibility of cloud storage.

backup.desc: You should always be able to access your TOTP code. That's why
backup.desc_strong: Zero-TOTP has 4 independant platform where you can decrypt your vault.

option.cli: To retrieve all your codes form your terminal (CLI unix only).
option.mobile: To retrieve all your codes directly in your pocket.
option.rescue: A very simple, minimal and ULTRA stable frontend, hosted on github pages where you can upload a backup your vault and decrypt it. In case of zero-totp's servers failure, your backup vaults can still be opened
option.zero_totp: The complete version of Zero-TOTP, up to date with all its features.

backup.title: And always have a

buyMeCoffee.desc: Open source & self hosted applications are possible thanks to your support. If you like this project, please consider

google.desc:
You can synchronize your encrypted vault with your google drive. This option is not mandatory, but it is highly recommended. In case of a server crash, you will be able to recover your encrypted vault from your google drive.
Your vault is still encrypted and only your passphrase can decrypt it. This passphrase is never stored anywhere.
google.title: Back up your encrypted vault in your google drive

local.desc:
You can download your encrypted vault and store it in your computer (or anywhere else). This option is not mandatory, but it is highly recommended. In case of a server crash, you will be able to recover your encrypted vault from your computer.
As always, your vault is still encrypted and only your passphrase can decrypt it. This passphrase is never stored anywhere.
local.title: Back up your encrypted vault in your computer

data.subtitle: You choose where to store your encrypted vault

zero_totp.desc: This is the default and mandatory option. Your encrypted vault is stored on our servers, hosted in Canada üá®üá¶, Switzerland üá®üá≠ and Germany üá©üá™. Nobody has access to your data, except you. This option is the one used when your log in to your account on zero-totp.com. You cannot disable this option, but you can backup your vault on your computer or on your google drive.
zero_totp.title: Store your encrypted vault on Zero-TOTP's servers

favicon.info1: When enabled, your browser will try to fetch the favicon of the website you are adding to your vault when displaying it. If it fails, it will display a default icon.
favicon.info2: The favicon is fetched by your browser using DuckDuckGo API (a privacy friendly search engine). Zero-TOTP does not transmit any information to DuckDuckGo or the target website. The URI or domain name is never transmitted to zero-totp servers.

warning.beta: Zero-TOTP is still in beta. This value will be customizable in the future.

changes.desc: We may update this Privacy Policy to reflect changes in our practices or legal requirements. We will notify you of any significant changes via email or through our website.
changes.title: Changes to this Privacy Policy

li1.long: We collect your email address, username, and account creation date for the purpose of creating and managing your Zero-TOTP account.

li2.long: We use Zero-Knowledge Encryption to store your TOTP codes securely. We have no knowledge of your TOTP codes, secrets, or application URLs.

li3.long: If you choose to enable the backup of your vault to Google Drive, we store identifiers (protected by encryption) for Google Drive integration. You can revoke at any moment your google drive integration. This will lead to the deletion of your identifiers.

li4.long: We use authentication cookies to securely manage your sessions. No tracking cookies are used.

li5.long: We retain the datetime of your last login on Zero-TOTP. Once you log in again, the previous date in erased by the new one. This information is used for implementing the data retention policy (see 4. Data Retention and User Control).

contact.desc1: If you have any questions or concerns about this Privacy Policy or your data, please contact us at
contact.title: Contact Us

cookies.desc: We only use authentication cookies for session management. No tracking cookies are used.
cookies.title: Cookies

intro.part1: Welcome to Zero-TOTP, a web application where users can securely store their TOTP codes for 2FA authentication with third-party services. At Zero-TOTP, we prioritize the privacy and security of your data. This Privacy Policy outlines how we collect, use, and protect your information. By using our services, you agree to the terms of this Privacy Policy.
intro.part2: This Privacy Policy aims to define the principles and guidelines implemented by the Zero-TOTP regarding the processing of personal data of users of the website zero-totp.com and rescue.zero-totp.com. The concept of "personal data" corresponds to the definition provided by Article 4 of the General Data Protection Regulation of the European Union (GDPR 2016/679). It refers to any information capable of directly or indirectly identifying a natural person, such as a username, email address, etc. Zero-TOTP affirms its commitment to complying with the applicable laws and regulations concerning data protection and undertakes to preserve their security, confidentiality, and integrity. Zero-TOTP formally commits not to sell, rent, exchange, or give away any personal information.

liability.desc1: While we take every reasonable measure to ensure the security and confidentiality of your data, we cannot guarantee absolute protection against all potential risks. We disclaim any responsibility for the loss, breach, or unauthorized access to your information. By using Zero-TOTP, you acknowledge and accept that the security of your data is dependent on factors beyond our control.
liability.desc2: We only provide assurance regarding the robust encryption algorithms and security measures we employ to safeguard your data during storage and transmission.
liability.title: Disclaimer of Liability

licence.desc1: Zero-TOTP is an open-source application distributed under the GNU General Public License version 3 (GPL 3). This means that our source code is publicly available, and you have the freedom to view, modify, and distribute the software in compliance with the terms of the GPL 3 license.
licence.desc2: By choosing to use Zero-TOTP, you acknowledge and agree to comply with the provisions of the GPL 3 license. You can access the complete source code of our application on
licence.desc3: Please note that while the source code is open and freely available, the use of Zero-TOTP as a service provided by us is subject to the terms outlined in this Privacy Policy.
licence.title: Open Source and GPL 3 License

location.long1: To maximize redundancy, replication, and availability, we store data in three countries: Canada, Germany, and Switzerland. This practice is compliant with the GDPR, as all these countries are recognized by the EU as acceptable for data transfer. Additionally, we adhere to Swiss privacy laws and Quebec's Law 25 on data protection.
location.long2: Please note that the list of countries where data is stored may change in the future. If we add a new country that is not an EU member, Canada, the USA, or Switzerland, we will notify users accordingly.
location.title: Data storage location

portability.long: To receive your data in a structured, machine-readable format.

correction.long: You can update your username, email, passphrase, and codes (along with their associated data) in your account. For any other corrections, you can contact developer[at]zero-totp.com.

retention.long1: We retain all data, including vault information, for a maximum of five years after your last login to comply with GDPR's data storage limitations. You can request the deletion of your account and all associated data through the account settings at any time. You are responsible of the deletion of all the encrypted backups of your vault that you downloaded and that have been stored on Google Drive.
retention.long2: Disaster recovery and data availability requirements mean that we have a legitimate interest in maintaining secure and immutable backups. Backups are kept for maxmimum 60 days. Erasure requests will leave those backups untouched, and we will only remove data from backups if legally compelled to.
retention.title: Data Retention and User Control

rights.desc2: Please contact us at developer[at]zero-totp.com to exercise these rights.

erasure.long: To request the deletion of your account and data.

rights.long: To request access to your personal information.

objection.long: To object to the processing of your data for specific purposes.

rectification.long: To request the correction of inaccurate or incomplete data.

rights.title: Your Rights

security.desc: We employ industry-standard security measures to protect your data. Passwords are hashed using BCRYPT, and key derivation uses PBKDF2 with 700,000 iterations. Data is encrypted using AES 256-bit encryption.
security.title: Security

thirdpart.part2: If the user enables the favicon preview, your browser will use the DuckDuckGo API to retrieve the favicon of the website. Please review the privacy policies of DuckDuckGo, as we have no control over their data handling practices. Zero-TOTP does not store any data related to the favicon preview, and the DuckDuckGo API is only used to retrieve the favicon of the website. The only data sent to DuckDuckGo is the URL of the website by your browser. Zero-TOTP does not access or store without encryption this data.

thirdparty.part1: If the user enables the Google Drive integration, we may integrate with third-party services for user convenience, such as Google Drive. Please review the privacy policies of these services, as we have no control over their data handling practices.

auth.long: To verify your identity and secure your account.

enc.long: To securely store your TOTP codes without knowledge of the actual codes, secrets, or application URLs.

hoohle.long: If enabled, to facilitate the backup of encrypted data to your Google Drive.

usage.part1: We use your information for the following purposes:

support.long: To respond to your inquiries and requests sent to

Thank you for your understanding and your help !
